issues.title: External handle is no longer being wrapped in an object for Node 0.11+, how can handle be validated?
issues.body:
In using the addonlayer, a handle (shim_ctx_t*) is returned and then passed around to be used in additional calls later.

To verify that all the proper values are being passed into our methods, we are doing JS validations on the parameters before calling back into the addon layer, however in Node 0.11.x the validations create a type error when they try to do `isNaN(handle)` or toString using `handle + ''`.

```
TypeError: Cannot convert object to primitive value
```

I originally had logged this issue against Node, but Fedor Indutny believes the error occurs because of the change in the addon layer, here 
https://github.com/tjfontaine/node-addon-layer/blob/master/src/shim.cc#L1645

It looks like this change was made purposefully for Node 0.11, so what do you recommend?

I had added a failing test to demonstrate the problem at 
https://github.com/tjfontaine/node-addon-layer-test/pull/1

issues.title: some objects created in binding layer are immediately collected
issues.body: for example `shim_buffer_new_external` may result in an immediate collection, the C++ destructor in the `shim_val_t` may be triggering that.

issues.title: Patches in the short term compatibility with <0.11.10
issues.body: This is a slight rollback of the last rollback, but 0.10.18 fails with HEAD of node-addon-layer. This reverts the relevant parts for 0.10 in the short term until there's time to fix it (or I suppose drop 0.10 support).

issues.title: Is it an external or an integer?
Err unpacking function args to SHIM_TYPE_FUNCTION
shim_unpack() should allocate shim_val_t for you

commit.message: saner persistent handling, squash a potential leak
work around newer compilers for right now

Update for v0.11.10 support

This reverts commit 68b18e443727cdd2ae70fc87b9dd076a2829c973.
make externals more useful on pre v0.11
remove a few more ifdef's in favor of a define
allow JS function calls to omit rval parameter
should be able to unpack functions
C module shouldn't have to know about C++ functions at all
turn on all warnings and make them errors
fix warnings on SmartOS with gcc 4.6.2
add SHIM_TYPE_BUFFER for value_is and unpack
allow use arbitrary data on a function
document module design, and native handles
better doxygen of core data types
add make callback, refactor function calling
bring the readme up to date slightly
if there's no return value return undefined
don't use container_of for queued work

the great rewrite

drop the jsapi history, and make user responsible for memory
management of values they create
actually free the allocs set on cleanup
use std::set for now instead of QUEUE
moving using statements into our namespace
make it compile with newer V8
